value.title: Blank row in DAX
value.excerpt: VALUES and DISTINCT are two functions that differ in how they could add a blank row to the result (or not). value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI
value.excerpt: Not a coder? Don't understand DAX syntax? DAX can be intimidating and difficult to learn. Frustrating even! Learning DAX can make Power BI very rewarding. Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Beginning the journey:  MS Learn: User DAX in Power BI Desktop (Free) https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/paths/dax-power-bi/

value.title: Introducing RANKX in DAX
value.excerpt: RANKX is a simple function used to rank a value within a list of values. value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: ALL vs ALLSelected in Power BI and DAX
value.excerpt: These two functions in DAX are often used instead of each other; ALL and ALLSELECTED. Their behavior can be similar in some contexts, but it can also be different in other contexts. value.title: ConcatenateX in Power BI and DAX   Concatenate Values of a Column
